alert.note: Alert for Casper Mountain; Natrona County Lower Elevations (Wyoming) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 17 at 2:40PM MDT by NWS Riverton
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of east central Natrona County through 315 PM MDT... At 238 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Beartrap Meadows County Park, or near Casper, moving southeast at 35 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph and nickel size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This storm will remain over mainly rural areas of east central Natrona County, including the following locations... Central Wyoming Fairgrounds, Casper Mountain, Rotary Park, Casper Mountain County Park and Fort Caspar Campground. This includes Interstate 25 between mile markers 187 and 189. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.88 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.

area.areaDesc: Casper Mountain; Natrona County Lower Elevations
